isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Performance Diagnostics - Test Procedures - 9. Injector Disable

svcprocinfo.para: To determine the cause of rough engine idle
The Injector Disable tests can only be done with the EST; MasterDiagnostics® software is required.
The Injector Disable tests allows the technician to shut off injectors to determine if a specific cylinder is contributing to engine performance. Injectors can be shut off one at a time.
When all cylinders are active, the contribution of each cylinder is 17% of its overall effect to maintain governed speed. The technician should monitor fuel rate and engine load.
This test is used in conjunction with " Test 10. Relative Compression " to distinguish between an injector problem or a mechanical problem.
Before doing the Automatic Test make sure Tests 1 through 8 were completed and the following conditions are maintained:

item.para: Make sure accessories are turned off (for example: fan and air conditioning). If these items were to cycle during this test it could corrupt the test results.
Keep EOT within a 2 °C (5 °F)range from the beginning to the end of the test. EOT affects injection timing; too much of a change in EOT temperature could corrupt the test results.

svcprocinfo.para: The Automatic Test is the preferred test, do the Manual Test - Engine Cold only if investigating a cold misfire.

svcsubproc.title: Automatic Test

note.para: If any injectors are removed and reinstalled or replaced, test drive vehicle for 32 km (20 mi) before checking for misfire or rough idle.

svcsubproc.para: The automatic test is best done when comparing cylinder to cylinder test data.

note.para: Do " Test 7. KOER Standard " before doing this test.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, use proper ventilation when operating an engine in a closed area, in order to remove deadly exhaust fumes. Inhalation of exhaust fumes may be fatal.

To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, before running engine for diagnostic or service procedures, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels.

step1.para: While engine is running, select D_KOER_IDT_V6.ssn in the Open Session File window, select Open to monitor engine operation.
Select V6 Injector Disable Tests from drop down menu.

note.para: The EOT indicator will change from red to green when engine temperature reaches 70 °C (158 °F) or higher.

item.para: If the EOT indicator is red, erroneous comparisons are likely from cylinder to cylinder.

When the EOT indicator is green and the engine temperature is 70 °C (158 °F) or higher, fuel rate and timing are more stable, making comparisons from cylinder to cylinder more accurate. Overall engine operation is more stable.

note.para: If any injectors are removed and reinstalled or replaced, test drive vehicle for 32 km (20 mi) before checking for misfire or rough idle.
While running the engine, listen for sound variations from cylinder to cylinder.

figure.caption: V6 Injector Disable Test Results (Auto Run - Text View)
V6 Injector Disable Test Results (Auto Run - Graph View)

svcsubproc.para: During Auto Run, injectors are shutoff one at a time (1 through 6 in numerical sequence). Base line data and results for each cylinder is displayed in the window (Text View) for V6 Injector Disable Test Results. Test data for each injector can also be viewed by selecting the (Graph View). When finished the engine will return to normal operation.

step1.para: Record data from window (Text View) on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If deviation values for average fuel rate and average engine load are less than the cut off values for fuel rate and engine load, the injector is suspect for weak cylinder contribution.
If only one deviation value is less than a cut off value, do not suspect that cylinder.

If a suspect cylinder(s) is identified, do " Test 10. Relative Compression
" to distinguish between an injector or mechanical problem.
If Test 10 shows that cylinders are mechanically sound, but Test 9 shows that one or more cylinders are bad, continue with step 6.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, do not allow engine fluids to stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails with soap and water, or a good hand cleaner. Wash or dispose of clothing or rags containing engine fluids. Engine fluids contain elements that may be unhealthy for skin and could cause cancer.

note.para: Engine fluids, oil, fuel, and coolant, are a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids according to local regulations. Never dispose of engine fluids in the trash, by pouring on the ground, in sewers, or in bodies of water.

step1.para: Remove valve covers following procedure in Engine Service Manual.
Replace faulty injector(s) and replace valve covers following procedures in the Engine Service Manual.
Test drive vehicle for 32 km (20 mi) to purge air from the ICP system fuel supply system, and check for rough idle.
If rough idle continues, do this test again.

entry.para: Failed connection from wiring harness to injector solenoid
Open or shorted wiring harness to injector solenoid

svcsubproc.title: Manual Test - Engine Cold
svcsubproc.para: The Manual Test is only done when diagnosing each cylinder for cold misfire, considering EOT changes.

note.para: The EOT indicator will change from red to green when engine temperature reaches 70 °C (158 °F) or higher.

item.para: If the EOT indicator is red, erroneous comparisons are likely from cylinder to cylinder.
However, when diagnosing a cold misfire, a technician can listen to tone changes from cylinder-to-cylinder.

When the EOT indicator is green and the engine temperature is 70 °C (158 °F) or higher, fuel rate and timing are more stable, making comparisons from cylinder to cylinder more accurate. Overall engine operation is more stable.

svcsubproc.para: Shut off one injector at a time and listen for changes in exhaust tone.

note.para: If any injectors are removed and reinstalled or replaced, test drive vehicle for 32 km (20 mi) before checking for misfire or rough idle.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, use proper ventilation when operating an engine in a closed area, in order to remove deadly exhaust fumes. Inhalation of exhaust fumes may be fatal.

To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, when running engine for diagnostic or service procedures, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels.

step1.para: While engine is running, select D_ KOER_IDT_V6.ssn. in the Open Session File window, select Open to monitor engine operation.
Select V6 Injector Disable Tests from drop down menu.
Select cylinder number and select Run. (Injector selected will be disabled and engine noise should change.)
Select Normal Operation. Injector will be enabled and engine noise should return to normal.
Repeat steps 4 and 5 for the remaining cylinders.

note.para: Listen for sound variations from cylinder to cylinder.
If any injectors are removed and reinstalled or replaced, test drive vehicle for 32 km (20 mi) before checking for misfire or rough idle.

step1.para: When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.
